title: Lewington: Rhythm, management and why Shilton's record is safe
shortDescription: MK Dons captain Dean Lewington on the role of rhythm in his career, management and why Peter Shilton's record of 1,005 Football League appearances is not in his sights.

title: Rooney and Vieira inducted into Premier League Hall of Fame
shortDescription: Wayne Rooney and Patrick Vieira have become the latest players to be inducted into the Premier League Hall of Fame.

title: My Greatest Goal: Defoe's derby delight
shortDescription: Jermain Defoe, Ryan Taylor and Martin Tyler look back to the 2015 Tyne-Wear derby and Defoe's stunning winner for Sunderland against Newcastle.

title: Pogba: Burglars stole my World Cup medal
shortDescription: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba has revealed his World Cup winner’s medal was among the items stolen during a recent burglary at his home.

title: Papers: Ten Hag undergoes Man Utd manager interview
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Wednesday's national newspapers...

title: Race to buy Chelsea: Ricketts family fly to London but face backlash
shortDescription: The Ricketts family are flying to London to meet key stakeholders of Chelsea as they wait to discover if they are on the shortlist of preferred bidders for the club.

title: Duggan: No regrets over Everton Women return
shortDescription: Toni Duggan has stressed she has no regrets about rejoining Everton and has optimism for better times ahead, including hopes of playing for England again.

title: Birmingham coach Bignot charged by FA over abusive language
shortDescription: Birmingham coach Marcus Bignot has been charged by the Football Association over language he allegedly used at the Women's Super League loss to Tottenham last month.

title: Championship on Sky: Four back-to-back games live on Good Friday
shortDescription: Here is how you can watch Championship matches live across Sky Sports throughout March and April.

title: Top tackler Mitchell tipped to impress with England
shortDescription: A spate of injuries has led to a surprise England call for Tyrick Mitchell - but he has the ability and mentality to seize his chance.

title: Arsenal boss Eidevall: Playing at Emirates can grow women's game
shortDescription: Jonas Eidevall believes playing at Emirates Stadium is the "right way forward" for Arsenal as they prepare for Wednesday's Champions League clash with Wolfsburg.

title: Reiten: Pipping Arsenal to WSL title would 'mean everything'
shortDescription: Chelsea's Guro Reiten, who could make her own history this week, tells Sky Sports why pipping Arsenal to the WSL title this season would be so special.

title: Mike Dean to retire from refereeing
shortDescription: Premier League referee Mike Dean will retire at the end of the 2021/22 season but is likely to continue as a full-time VAR official.

title: Merson Says: No purpose playing Pickford in friendlies
shortDescription: Paul Merson says playing Jordan Pickford against Switzerland and Ivory Coast serves no purpose to England and Gareth Southgate's World Cup preparations.

title: Rangers accuse fan group of creating 'propaganda' against club
shortDescription: Rangers have accused fan shareholder group Club 1872 of being "intent on causing damage to the club" and creating a "propaganda war".

title: World Cup 2022: When is the draw for Qatar?
shortDescription: From key dates to kick-off times, here's all you need to know about next year's tournament.

title: Robertson unlikely to face Poland
shortDescription: Andy Robertson is unlikely to play in Scotland's friendly against Poland at Hampden Park on Thursday.

title: Is this where Chelsea take charge of WSL title race?
shortDescription: WSL holders Chelsea Women have been playing catch-up all season - but could finally return to the top of the table live on Sky Sports on Wednesday.

title: The Great Debate: Racism in Sport - is it here to stay?
shortDescription: Here at Sky, we are really keen to hear from viewers who have had real life experiences – has a racist incident put you off attending or participating in a game?

title: UK-Ireland confident over hosting Euro 2028 | Still no rival bids
shortDescription: The football associations in the UK and Ireland are confident they will be confirmed as Euro 2028 hosts, SSN has been told, with no rival bid to host the tournament.
